metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: GIS Data of the Monterey Bay

abstract.gco:CharacterString: This line shapefile shows the estimated major fault lines in Monterey Bay, California. These data were digitized from "Fault Activity Map of California and Adjacent Areas" (1994) and "Geology of the Central California Continental Margin" (1989). Shapefiles for this layer are available in WGS84 and UTM Zone 10 (NAD83) projections. This layer is part of the GIS Data of the Monterey Bay collection, a compilation of data and imagery of the Monterey Bay area, including coastline, imagery, and bathymetry.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: This dataset is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data. This collection of data provides documented layers of of the Monterey Bay to persons/institutions of interest throughout the research and educational communities.

credit.gco:CharacterString: Maher, N. (1998). Fault Lines: Monterey Bay, California, 1992. Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Users are not permitted to make any commercial use of the data, to sell, assign, sublicense, or otherwise transfer the data or remove any copyright notice, without prior written permission from MBARI. The data have not been designed as a navigational aid, and you are not permitted to use them for this purpose. In addition, you are not permitted to use MBARI's name or its initials (a registered trademark) or to suggest that MBARI endorses your project or product, without its express written consent.

title.gco:CharacterString: GIS Data of the Monterey Bay

environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.0.3035

supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString:
All data are registered to the WGS84 datum with two versions of each feature, image, and grid coverage included in the collection. One is in a Geographic (decimal degrees) coordinate system and the second is in a Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) zone 10 projection.
For strict accuracy and hard-copy production requiring feature, grid, and/or image data, the UTM projection coverages should be used. In fact, some ArcView functions will not be available unless the data are displayed in a projection. This is because a Geographic Coordinate System is NOT a projection but rather a spherical coordinate system dealing directly in latitude and longitude. However, at the scale of maps covering Monterey Bay, the errors produced by ignoring this fact are small.

title.gco:CharacterString: Feature Catalog for Fault Lines: Monterey Bay, California, 1994

description.gco:CharacterString: Maps were scanned in, then digitized on screen in Photoshop. Coverage was then geoReferenced in ARC/INFO.

The 1994 map is a revision of the 1975 Fault map of California and replaces the Preliminary fault activity map of California. Map sheet includes text and geologic time line; faults indicated by colored lines and numbers keyed to appendix.

title.gco:CharacterString: Fault Activity Map of California and Adjacent Areas

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: California Dept. of Conservation, Division of Mines and Geology

description.gco:CharacterString: Geologic Map of Central California Coast

title.gco:CharacterString: Geology of the Central California Continental Margin
